title: Periodic Table: First 20 Elements
description: Foundation elements kids should know — master these first before expanding

elements.name: Hydrogen
elements.uses: Water, balloons, rocket fuel, fuel cells
elements.realWorld: Floats balloons, makes water (H₂O), lightest element in universe
elements.memory_tip: Picture a HERO with a HYDROGEN BALLOON flying to the SKY
elements.rhymePeg: 1 = Bun: Hydrogen Bun floating away
elements.story: The HYDROGEN HERO started his adventure...
elements.associationImage: A silver balloon with 'H' floating up to the clouds
elements.funFact: Hydrogen is the most abundant element in the universe!

elements.name: Helium
elements.uses: Party balloons, blimps, scuba diving, weather balloons
elements.realWorld: Makes your voice funny when you inhale it, lifts balloons, glow in the dark
elements.memory_tip: Imagine HELIUM in a BALLOON making FUNNY VOICES at a party
elements.rhymePeg: 2 = Shoe: Helium Shoe floating away
elements.story: ...met HELIUM floating through the air making funny sounds
elements.associationImage: A red party balloon squeaking out high-pitched sounds
elements.funFact: Helium is the only element that doesn't solidify under normal pressure!

elements.name: Lithium
elements.uses: Batteries (phones, cars, laptops), mood stabilizers (medicine)
elements.realWorld: Powers your phone and laptop, inside your car battery
elements.memory_tip: LITHIUM is a LIGHT metal that LIGHTS UP your PHONE
elements.rhymePeg: 3 = Tree: Lithium Tree with glowing leaves
elements.story: ...climbed LITHIUM LADDER glowing like a lightbulb
elements.associationImage: A phone battery with lightning bolts jumping out
elements.funFact: Lithium is used to make rechargeable batteries for electric cars!

elements.name: Beryllium
elements.uses: Aerospace alloys, lightweight planes, X-ray windows, medical instruments
elements.realWorld: Airplane wings contain beryllium, used in dental tools
elements.memory_tip: BERYLLIUM is BELL-shaped and SUPER STRONG but SUPER LIGHT
elements.mnemonic: ...Beachballs made of the STRONGEST LIGHT METAL
elements.rhymePeg: 4 = Door: Beryllium Door super strong but featherlight
elements.story: ...knocked on a BERYLLIUM DOOR strong as steel but light as feathers
elements.associationImage: An airplane wing looking like a shiny bell
elements.funFact: Beryllium is so strong but light that it's used in spacecraft and fighter jets!

elements.name: Boron
elements.uses: Slime (borax), laundry detergent, glass, cosmetics
elements.realWorld: In slime, detergent, tempered glass, makeup
elements.memory_tip: BORON makes SLIME and CLEANS your CLOTHES with BORAX
elements.mnemonic: ...grabbed a BORON BALLOON made of SLIME
elements.rhymePeg: 5 = Hive: Boron Hive buzzing with sticky slime
elements.story: ...sat on BORON SLIME that stuck to his thighs
elements.associationImage: A glob of slime with borax crystals in it
elements.funFact: Borax (boron compound) is so common it's in most laundry detergents!

elements.name: Carbon
elements.uses: Diamonds, graphite, coal, pencil lead, charcoal, DNA
elements.realWorld: YOU are made of carbon! Diamonds are carbon! Pencils contain carbon!
elements.memory_tip: CARBON is in DIAMONDS, PENCIL LEAD, and YOU (your body is carbon)
elements.mnemonic: ...saw CARBON SKELETON dancing (you're made of carbon!)
elements.rhymePeg: 6 = Sticks: Carbon Sticks of pencil lead and charcoal
elements.story: ...danced with CARBON SKELETON shining like diamonds
elements.associationImage: A diamond, pencil, and a skeleton all connected
elements.funFact: Diamond and graphite are both pure carbon but arranged differently!

elements.name: Nitrogen
elements.uses: Fertilizer, food preservation, explosives, air, DNA
elements.realWorld: Makes plants grow (fertilizer), 78% of air you breathe
elements.memory_tip: NITROGEN is in the AIR you BREATHE and FEEDS plants to grow BIG
elements.rhymePeg: 7 = Heaven: Nitrogen Heaven where plants grow to the sky
elements.story: ...smelled NITROGEN in the air making plants grow tall to heaven
elements.associationImage: Green plants growing upward, air molecules floating
elements.relatedElement: Oxygen (makes up most of our air with N₂ and O₂)
elements.funFact: Even though nitrogen is inert, bacteria convert it into forms plants can eat!

elements.name: Oxygen
elements.uses: Breathing, fire, water, rusting, combustion, medical oxygen
elements.realWorld: You breathe oxygen, fire needs it to burn, makes water (H₂O)
elements.memory_tip: OXYGEN makes FIRE burn, YOU BREATHE it, it makes WATER
elements.mnemonic: ...rode OXYGEN WAVES in the ocean making fire sparkle
elements.rhymePeg: 8 = Gate: Oxygen Gate burning with fire
elements.story: ...rode OXYGEN WAVES that turned to FIRE
elements.associationImage: A flame burning bright, water splashing
elements.relatedElement: Hydrogen (makes water), Nitrogen (in air with it)
elements.funFact: Oxygen was named because people thought it was needed to make acids!

elements.name: Fluorine
elements.uses: Toothpaste, Teflon (non-stick pans), uranium enrichment, refrigerants
elements.realWorld: In toothpaste to prevent cavities, makes pans non-stick (Teflon)
elements.memory_tip: FLUORINE in TOOTHPASTE keeps TEETH SHINY and prevents CAVITIES
elements.mnemonic: ...found FLUORINE FIRE that made teeth sparkle
elements.rhymePeg: 9 = Vine: Fluorine Vine shiny and sparkly
elements.story: ...found FLUORINE FIRE that made teeth shine bright
elements.associationImage: A sparkly toothbrush, shiny white teeth
elements.funFact: Fluorine is so reactive that even glass containers melt if you put it in them!

elements.name: Neon
elements.uses: Neon signs, glowing lights, advertising, aurora (northern lights)
elements.realWorld: Glowing neon signs in cities, pretty lights at night
elements.memory_tip: NEON glows BRIGHT in neon SIGNS and makes PRETTY LIGHTS
elements.mnemonic: ...hid in NEON NIGHTCLUB with glowing signs everywhere
elements.rhymePeg: 10 = Hen: Neon Hen glowing bright red
elements.story: ...hid in NEON NIGHTCLUB glowing bright red on the head
elements.associationImage: A glowing neon sign, colorful glowing lights
elements.funFact: Neon lights were invented in 1910 and became famous for advertising signs!

elements.name: Sodium
elements.uses: Salt (NaCl), food preservation, street lamps, medicine
elements.realWorld: Table salt on your food (NaCl), in your tears and sweat
elements.memory_tip: SODIUM is SALT (NaCl) on your POPCORN and FOOD
elements.rhymePeg: Starting new count - or use 11th for extended
elements.story: ...went to kitchen, sprinkled SODIUM SALT on popcorn
elements.associationImage: A salt shaker, popcorn with salt crystals
elements.funFact: Your body needs sodium to function, but too much is bad for you!

elements.name: Magnesium
elements.uses: Milk, bones, flares, alloys, vitamins, medicines
elements.realWorld: In milk to make bones strong, your muscles need it
elements.memory_tip: MAGNESIUM in MILK makes BONES STRONG like a MAGNET pulls
elements.rhymePeg: 12 = Shoe (new): Magnesium Shoe stepping in milk
elements.story: ...drank MAGNESIUM MILK for strong bones
elements.associationImage: A glass of milk with strong bones glowing
elements.funFact: Magnesium burns so bright it was used in old camera flashes!

elements.name: Aluminum
elements.uses: Foil, soda cans, airplanes, construction, cooking
elements.realWorld: Aluminum foil in your kitchen, soda cans, airplane wings
elements.memory_tip: ALUMINUM foil WRAPS food, CANS hold drinks, PLANES fly
elements.rhymePeg: 13 = Tree (new): Aluminum Tree made of shiny cans
elements.story: ...wrapped everything in ALUMINUM FOIL in the kitchen
elements.associationImage: Aluminum foil, soda can, airplane wing
elements.funFact: Aluminum is the most recycled material and never loses quality!

elements.name: Silicon
elements.uses: Sand, glass, computer chips, solar panels, concrete
elements.realWorld: Beach sand, glass in windows, makes computer chips
elements.memory_tip: SILICON is in SAND at the beach, GLASS in windows, COMPUTER CHIPS
elements.mnemonic: ...played in SILICON SAND on the beach
elements.rhymePeg: 14 = Door (new): Silicon Door transparent like glass
elements.story: ...played in SILICON SAND making glass shapes
elements.associationImage: Beach sand, glass window, computer chip
elements.funFact: Silicon is the main ingredient in sand and glass!

elements.name: Phosphorus
elements.uses: Matches, fertilizer, bones, teeth, DNA, explosives
elements.realWorld: Inside matches to make fire, in your bones and teeth
elements.memory_tip: PHOSPHORUS in MATCHES makes FIRE and in BONES keeps them STRONG
elements.rhymePeg: 15 = Hive (new): Phosphorus Hive buzzing with fire
elements.story: ...lit PHOSPHORUS MATCHES creating bright fire
elements.associationImage: A lit match, glowing fire, strong bones
elements.funFact: White phosphorus glows in the dark without being heated!

elements.name: Sulfur
elements.uses: Matches, batteries, fertilizer, rotten eggs, volcanic
elements.realWorld: Rotten eggs smell like sulfur, yellow powder
elements.memory_tip: SULFUR smells like ROTTEN EGGS (yuck!!) and burns in MATCHES
elements.rhymePeg: 16 = Sticks (new): Sulfur Sticks burning yellow
elements.story: ...smelled SULFUR stinking like rotten eggs
elements.associationImage: Rotten egg, yellow powder, burning match
elements.funFact: Volcanoes release sulfur and that's why they smell so bad!

elements.name: Chlorine
elements.uses: Swimming pools, bleach, sterilizing, disinfectant, salt (NaCl)
elements.realWorld: Chlorine smell in pools keeps water clean, bleach whitens clothes
elements.memory_tip: CHLORINE in POOLS makes water CLEAN and BLEACH cleans your CLOTHES
elements.mnemonic: ...caught CHLORINE FISH in the SWIMMING POOL
elements.rhymePeg: 17 = Heaven (new): Chlorine Heaven with glowing pools
elements.story: ...caught CHLORINE FISH in a bright swimming pool
elements.associationImage: Swimming pool water, bleach bottle, clean white clothes
elements.funFact: Chlorine was used as a chemical weapon in wars but is also essential for safety!

elements.name: Argon

properties.density: Third most abundant in atmosphere, inert

elements.uses: Neon signs, light bulbs, welding, scientific instruments
elements.realWorld: Glowing purple/blue in old light bulbs and neon signs, glow sticks
elements.memory_tip: ARGON glows PURPLE in neon SIGNS and makes GLOW STICKS
elements.rhymePeg: 18 = Gate (new): Argon Gate glowing purple
elements.story: ...swam through ARGON CLOUDS glowing bright purple
elements.associationImage: Glowing neon sign, purple glow stick, light bulb
elements.relatedElement: Neon (both are noble gases that glow)
elements.funFact: Argon is used in welding because it doesn't react with hot metals!

elements.name: Potassium
elements.uses: Bananas, fertilizer, body health, muscles, nerves
elements.realWorld: Bananas are full of potassium for energy and muscles
elements.memory_tip: POTASSIUM in BANANAS gives you ENERGY and STRONG MUSCLES
elements.rhymePeg: 19 = Vine (new): Potassium Vine with bananas hanging
elements.story: ...found POTASSIUM BANANAS full of energy
elements.associationImage: Yellow banana, lightning bolts showing energy
elements.funFact: Bananas have so much potassium they're slightly radioactive!

elements.name: Calcium
elements.uses: Bones, teeth, milk, shells, concrete, limestone
elements.realWorld: Makes bones and teeth strong, in milk and cheese
elements.memory_tip: CALCIUM in MILK and DAIRY makes BONES and TEETH STRONG
elements.bodyPart: Toes (circle back - end of first body)
elements.rhymePeg: 20 = Hen (new): Calcium Hen with strong bones
elements.story: ...drank CALCIUM MILK to build strong bones
elements.associationImage: Glass of milk, strong bones, white teeth, seashell
elements.funFact: Your bones are about 40% calcium - strong bones need calcium!
